Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is caked with a dark-brown resinous material, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.169)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36374) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36374)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 231 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13420 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
